Description: Seven small, dark brown, brown and natural coloured wool textile fragments (fabric type M) used as a wrapping. The spinning direction of warp and weft of both fragments is 's'. The fragments are a combination of weft faced and plain weave samples. The thread count is 3-7 wefts per 10mm and 3 warps per 10mm. The yarns are fine and some appear to have been dyed. The fragment with the hem has irregularly alternate brown and natural warp pairs and primarily natural wefts. The hem sewing thread is a bluish wool (there is no longer evidence of blue wool sewing thread at hs seam) consisting of 2 elements 's'-spun and 'z'-plied. A rough seam, beside the hem, is sewn with brown wool consisting of 2 's'-spun elements and a natural wool thread consisting of 2 elements 's'-spun and 'z'-plied.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.2.74D (excavation object cat. no.)
